attributes.action: allow out of date produce to be returned to the supermarket for a refund
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Supermarkets only pay suppliers for the goods they sell. If a product does not sell in a supermarket the farmer does not get paid.

Why should we the consumer therefore not be allowed to return goods that we have not used and are past there sell by date.

Unused produce should be able to be returned for a refund? They are our suppliers just as the farmers are their suppliers. Why cant it work both ways.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
